caption:
This photograph features two men in a laboratory setting, filled with scientific apparatus and equipment.

One of the men, visible in the foreground, is an older individual with glasses and a receding hairline. He is wearing a white lab coat over a shirt and tie, and is seated with his focus directed towards a cylindrical object in front of him, which appears to be connected to a chart recorder with graphs. The other man is standing behind a large, complex arrangement of glass equipment, akin to a chemistry setup involving round-bottom flasks, tubing, and stands. He is wearing a white short-sleeve shirt and is attentively working on or adjusting the equipment.

The background is cluttered with various other items, indicative of a busy lab. There are more scientific instruments, containers, and additional pieces of what appears to be laboratory glassware arranged on shelves and workspaces.

Overall, the scene depicts a typical scientific research or testing environment, with the individuals engaged in experimental or measurement tasks using sophisticated tools and machinery, suggesting work that requires precision and technical expertise.
title: Edgar Stephens, professor of environmental science at the Statewide Air Pollution Research Center
